head.title: National Briefing | Washington: One Small Sale For 'Fair Trade' Coffee

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | Washington: One Small Sale For 'Fair Trade' Coffee

abstract.p: Group of 60 Democratic congressmen press Capitol's cafeterias to sell coffee that yields higher profit to growers (S)

block.p: A group of 60 Democratic congressmen pressed the Capitol's cafeterias to sell coffee that yields higher profits to growers. The contractor providing food services for the Capitol agreed to a trial service for what supporters call ''fair trade'' coffee once a week in the Longworth Office Building coffee shop. Farmers who grow fair trade coffee and export directly earn $1.26 a pound compared with about 20 cents a pound for farmers who use middlemen, said Kimberly Easson of Transfair USA, a group that certifies the coffee.
